page.title: 04Friday Bridge Farming
page.content: Friday Bridge is in the middle of rich Fen agricultural land. Some is owned by the Council, Martins and the Co-op have quite a lot. Some of the council land is divided into allotments. Some land is worked by smallholders. The big farmers grow mainly barley, wheat, sugarbeet, potatoes, onions, beans and peas. In addition the small farmers grow courgettes, cauliflowers, cabbages. The fruits they grow on the land are strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, gooseberries. In the north of the area are some fruit trees such as apple trees, plum trees and pear trees. There are some flowers grown in the area such as tulips and daffodils. There are not many animals apart from two small flocks of shee, a few fat cattle and chickens.
